issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: euca-modify-instance-attribute does not appear to work. Attempting to change the security group of an instance produces the following results: #Here's the instance: {code}# euca-describe-instances i-2b4e712d RESERVATION r-3548c3c8 794707502664 default comments.body:
[~jkennedy], 

What network mode are you using?  euca-modify-instance-attribute for security group id is only for VPC.  I wasn't sure if you were using a VPC enabled cloud or not.
{code}
# euca-modify-instance-attribute --help
....
  -g GROUP, --group-id GROUP
                        [VPC only] Change the security group(s) the instance
                        is in
{code}
It would also help to provide how you reproduced it on AWS, and if you were using a VPC security group or not. 

This is important because if you check the [AWS documentation regarding security groups|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-network-security.html], it has the following table at the bottom:
{quote}
*[EC2-VPC] Modify the security groups for an instance*
* modify-instance-attribute (AWS CLI)
* ec2-modify-instance-attribute (Amazon EC2 CLI)
* Edit-EC2InstanceAttribute (AWS Tools for Windows PowerShell)
{quote}

[~jkennedy],

In addition, which customer is seeing this issue?  If a customer raised this issue, please reference the Zendesk ticket.  If not, we should be raising this as a EUCA if it is indeed an issue with Eucalyptus  VPC.

[~hspencer]

Networking mode is EDGE; the AWS setup is not VPC, just a vanilla setup. Also, the AWS documentation mentions that it's for VPC (here: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/CommandLineReference/ApiReference-cmd-ModifyInstanceAttribute.html ) under the -g (group) section, but our docs don't actually mention VPC at all in regards to euca-modify-instance-attribute, unless it's listed somewhere I'm not looking: https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.0/index.html#euca2ools-guide/euca-modify-instance-attribute.html . Also, this command isn't mentioned in the VPC-specific section of the docs: https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.0/index.html#euca2ools-guide/vpc_euca2ools_intro.html

You're right about this being a EUCA, though! Thanks.

[~jkennedy],

So its not a bug since you aren't using it on a Eucalyptus VPC cloud correct or did  you test it as well on a Eucalyptus VPC cloud?  If this is a documentation bug, then I recommend moving this to a DOC project.  Does this make sense?
[~jkennedy], changing the security groups for an instance is only supported with a VPC (default or otherwise) on both AWS and Eucalyptus.
